interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Nail Clipper Set, GIDIBII Luxury 18 in 1 Stainless Steel Nail Clipper Kit, Manicure Pedicure Care Tools with Portable Travel Case Review Date: 2020/04/21 Store: GIDIBII Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Brand': 'GIDIBII', 'Blade Material': 'Stainless Steel', 'Item Dimensions LxWxH': '5.8 x 3.8 x 0.8 inches', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '5.8 x 3.8 x 0.8 inches; 11.99 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'Manicure Set', 'UPC': '799445199218', 'Manufacturer': 'GIDIBII'} Review Text: Short summary: I like a number of the instruments available in this set; they work well for my needs, and for the needs of our family members.
The case securely holds each instrument in its slot; but some instruments are tough to remove from their slots.

More details:

a) Case is soft to the touch and comfortable to hold. There is a tab that I press in to open the case; to close the case, I press both parts of the case together.

b) One compartment (the side with the tab) holds:
--- Nail File
Works well to smooth out my nails after I trimmed them.
--- Fingernail Clipper
The curved blades cut my nails well. The lever has square-shaped divots that give good
grip. It is a bit hard to rotate the lever around the pin; but, with continued use, it should
be easier to open and close the lever. There is no nail file attached to the clipper
--- Nose trimmer
I did not find this to be as good at cutting my nose hairs.
---.Cuticle nipper
This trims my cuticles well.
--- Eyebrow trimmer
This does a decent job in trimming eyebrow
--- Cuspidal/Obtuse push-type broach
I didn't have a need to use this; but several family members used this, and they say it
does an adequate job with their nail polish routine
--- Ear pick
I tried it, but I didn't like the sensation of it scraping against the inside of my ear.

c) The other compartment holds:
--- Toenail clipper
Curved blades cut my toenails well; however, it does not cut my big toenail because
that nail has too much fungus and is too thick. I used a different toenail clipper
recommended by my foot doctor.
--- Oblique nail clipper
I don't use this often for cutting my nail; but I like how easily it cuts the nails. Other
family members love it, and are more familiar in using it
--- Nail cleaning knife
I don't use this; others in my family say it works well to remove the debris under their nails.
--- Tweezers
My family members do not like this, because it doesn't open enough for them to use; so they went
back to using their preferred tweezers
--- Zig Zag callus remover
--- Oblique callus remover
--- Flat callus remover
note: so far, those of us with calluses (including me) do not have them so thick that
they need removal using these instruments.
--- Dead skin fork
a family member used it; she says it is quite useful in removing the loose skin right
around her cuticle area
--- Ear pick (has something like a serrated shape, perhaps)
I much prefer this ear pick; it felt more natural and is like what I used in the past.
--- Acne tool (one end with a circular loop; other end with a pick)
--- Acne tool (one end with a circular loop; other end with a scoop)
None of our family members currently have acne, so we haven't had a chance to try it;
but, we have similar instruments just like these, and those worked well when we've
needed to deal with our skin issues.

Lastly: I would have liked the case to be slightly larger, so that it is easier to remove all these instruments. When I removed all the instruments, some of which I used, others which my family members used, and then put the instruments back into the case, we couldn't get it to close. Finally, we removed the toenail clippers, and that easily closed the case.

Overall, this is a good manicure set, with instruments that I and/or my family members find to be very useful for our particular needs. Review Title: Has the tools needed to handle our face/hands/feet/skin issues. Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Floss Picks BEOKREU {'Package Dimensions': '7.48 x 4.92 x 1.5 inches; 1.59 Ounces', 'UPC': '745679748517'} This Floss Picks Dental Floss product contains a total of 200 dental floss. There are 4 separate bags. Each bag contains 50 dental floss. Each bag is resealable.

I have used these particular dental floss at various times of the day for the past 7 days. So far, not one dental floss has broken or become frayed. The floss moves between my teeth in a smooth manner.

This dental floss has no flavor.

I used these dental floss at home, and took a bag with me to work so that I can discreetly used them after eating lunch.

This dental floss works as intended to help me keep my teeth and gums healthy. Dental floss moves easily between my teeth. None has broken or frayed so far. No flavor. Mountain Falls 100% Acetone Dip-It Nail Polish Remover for Natural Nails, Maximum Strength, 9 Fluid Ounce Mountain Falls ['For those with a passion for nail art, Mountain Falls Nail Polish Remover 100% Acetone is a manicure essential. This salon-strength formula quickly removes nail tips as well as glue and gel nail polish in a convenient dip-it container.'] {'Brand': 'Mountain Falls', 'Item Form': 'Liquid', 'Item Weight': '0.5 Pounds', 'Unit Count': '9 Fl Oz', 'Package Dimensions': '3.15 x 3.07 x 2.6 inches; 8 Ounces', 'Manufacturer': 'Vi-Jon'} This product - 100% acetone nail polish remover - comes with an inner protective foil seal.

When I twisted the lid to open it, even with the seal intact, I could feel slight amounts of nail polish remover around the neck of the bottle and also smelled the remover.
Upon removing the seal, there is a transparent plastic seal that also needs to be removed prior to being able to dip a finger into this container.

Two of my family members used this product. I watched them dip their finger down into the brush area, twist the finger right and left. Then, move the finger up and down against the brush.
They say it's effective in removing the nail polish. Effective nail polish remover. Strong acetone smell, even with intact protective seal. Pick & Pick (Gentle/metal allergy free material) MIND UP {'Package Dimensions': '7 x 1.2 x 0.5 inches; 0.63 Ounces'} [[VIDEOID:4ec0f08a9d346155d134f855861e62]] This tooth cleaning tool - Pick & Pick - measures about 6-1/4 inches long.

At one end of the tool is a flexible, sharp pick, which I use to remove debris from in between my teeth.
At the other end of the tool is a flexible, flat-shaped pick, which I use to scrape unwanted particles and debris from between my gum lines and teeth.

The flat end of the pick is too flexible for me to remove most of the stubborn particles in the areas between my teeth and gums. I needed to hold my fingers as close to the flat end as possible to get good leverage. Even then, I couldn't remove the debris.

The sharp end of the pick works a bit better in removing debris from between my teeth; but for those debris that are really stuck, this pick can't get the debris out because the end keeps flexing.

This tool doesn't do a good job of removing resistant particles/debris from my teeth. Too flexible to remove stubborn particles from between teeth or between teeth and gums. Teeth Whitening Powder Kit 2.1oz Activated Charcoal Toothpaste Powder Teeth Whitener Remove Coffee Wine Tobacco Stains Gum Health and Fresh Breath with Toothbrush & Tongue Cleaner BeaGirl {'Brand': 'BeaGirl', 'Item Form': 'Powder', 'Unit Count': '1 Count', 'Item Weight': '2.1 Ounces', 'Flavor': 'Mint', 'Package Dimensions': '8.98 x 6.93 x 2.24 inches; 2.1 Ounces', 'UPC': '192242892311'} This Activated Charcoal Powder comes in a 2.1-oz round can.
A soft bristle toothbrush (with a wood handle) and a tongue scraper is also included.

After opening the cap, there is a tear-drop shaped "pick" that can be used to lift up the inner lid to reveal the charcoal powder.

This is my first time using activated charcoal as a means to whiten my teeth.

I wet the toothbrush, dipped it into the charcoal, and started brushing my teeth in my normal manner. Bits of the powder sprayed over various areas of the bathroom sink, and as I continued to brush and spit, the sink itself was covered with a combination of water/saliva/charcoal.
There was a taste of the powder (a bit bitter taste) on my tongue as I brushed.

Rinsing with water did not remove all the charcoal in my mouth; so I brushed again with toothpaste, and rinsed with more water. That did the trick.
It took a bit of time to clean up the mess I made.

The next occasions that I brushed using this activated charcoal, I did not brush as vigorously, and made less of a mess, as I adjusted to how to use the product.

In the last 3 weeks since using this, I have noticed the top part of a teeth (the top 5% of it) of the front four teeth are slightly brighter than the rest of the teeth.

The tongue scraper is a helpful addition to my dental hygiene routine. Slight whitening at very tips of my teeth. A bit messy to use. Nail Clipper Set, GIDIBII Luxury 18 in 1 Stainless Steel Nail Clipper Kit, Manicure Pedicure Care Tools with Portable Travel Case GIDIBII {'Brand': 'GIDIBII', 'Blade Material': 'Stainless Steel', 'Item Dimensions LxWxH': '5.8 x 3.8 x 0.8 inches', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '5.8 x 3.8 x 0.8 inches; 11.99 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'Manicure Set', 'UPC': '799445199218', 'Manufacturer': 'GIDIBII'} Short summary: I like a number of the instruments available in this set; they work well for my needs, and for the needs of our family members.
The case securely holds each instrument in its slot; but some instruments are tough to remove from their slots.

More details:

a) Case is soft to the touch and comfortable to hold. There is a tab that I press in to open the case; to close the case, I press both parts of the case together.

b) One compartment (the side with the tab) holds:
--- Nail File
Works well to smooth out my nails after I trimmed them.
--- Fingernail Clipper
The curved blades cut my nails well. The lever has square-shaped divots that give good

I did not find this to be as good at cutting my nose hairs.
---.Cuticle nipper
This trims my cuticles well.
--- Eyebrow trimmer
This does a decent job in trimming eyebrow
--- Cuspidal/Obtuse push-type broach
I didn't have a need to use this; but several family members used this, and they say it
does an adequate job with their nail polish routine
--- Ear pick
I tried it, but I didn't like the sensation of it scraping against the inside of my ear.

c) The other compartment holds:
--- Toenail clipper
Curved blades cut my toenails well; however, it does not cut my big toenail because
that nail has too much fungus and is too thick. I used a different toenail clipper
recommended by my foot doctor.
--- Oblique nail clipper
I don't use this often for cutting my nail; but I like how easily it cuts the nails. Other
family members love it, and are more familiar in using it
--- Nail cleaning knife
I don't use this; others in my family say it works well to remove the debris under their nails.
--- Tweezers
My family members do not like this, because it doesn't open enough for them to use; so they went
back to using their preferred tweezers
--- Zig Zag callus remover
--- Oblique callus remover
--- Flat callus remover
note: so far, those of us with calluses (including me) do not have them so thick that
they need removal using these instruments.
--- Dead skin fork
a family member used it; she says it is quite useful in removing the loose skin right
around her cuticle area
--- Ear pick (has something like a serrated shape, perhaps)
I much prefer this ear pick; it felt more natural and is like what I used in the past.
--- Acne tool (one end with a circular loop; other end with a pick)
--- Acne tool (one end with a circular loop; other end with a scoop)
None of our family members currently have acne, so we haven't had a chance to try it;
but, we have similar instruments just like these, and those worked well when we've
needed to deal with our skin issues.

Lastly: I would have liked the case to be slightly larger, so that it is easier to remove all these instruments. When I removed all the instruments, some of which I used, others which my family members used, and then put the instruments back into the case, we couldn't get it to close. Finally, we removed the toenail clippers, and that easily closed the case.

Overall, this is a good manicure set, with instruments that I and/or my family members find to be very useful for our particular needs. Has the tools needed to handle our face/hands/feet/skin issues.
profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Health Conscious**: Strong emphasis on dental hygiene and nail care, reflecting a holistic grooming approach.
- **Practical and Functional**: Values effective and reliable products, with satisfaction contingent upon performance and efficacy across personal care categories.
- **Convenience-Oriented**: Prefers easy-to-use, portable options that simplify quick and efficient personal care routines.
- **Minimalist Preference**: Favors straightforward solutions that minimize distractions and clutter in grooming practices.
- **Positive Experience**: Generally exhibits a favorable attitude towards quality personal care items, as indicated by a history of high ratings and positive reviews. Recent experiences, however, have exposed inconsistencies in product effectiveness.
- **Daily User**: Committed to regular hygiene and grooming practices, showcasing dedication to maintaining dental and nail health.
- **Critical Evaluator**: Recently expressed mixed results with a dental whitening product, appreciating some effects but finding it messy and requiring extra clean-up. Additionally, feedback on a nail clipper set highlighted a balance between usefulness and some design limitations, particularly in the ease of accessing tools and closing the case.
- **Family-Oriented**: Considers the needs of family members when assessing grooming tools, valuing versatility and performance for a broader range of personal care needs.

Overall, the user combines a focus on practicality, family needs, and quality in their personal care regimen while providing constructive feedback to enhance their grooming experiences.
